impression: [item] No acute abnormality within the chest. [item] Scattered bilateral subpleural pulmonary nodules measure up to 5 mm in size. No follow-up needed if patient is low-risk (and has no known or suspected primary neoplasm). Non-contrast chest CT can be considered in 12 months if patient is high-risk. This recommendation follows the consensus statement: Guidelines for Management of Incidental Pulmonary Nodules Detected on CT Images: From the Fleischner Society 2017; Radiology 2017; 284:228243. [item] Bilateral renal cysts seen. [item] Emphysema (ICD10-J43.9).
